intro: Ione paleacea, commonly known as the pale morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, pale blue to white flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Ione paleacea is an annual herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
